website_summaries.verdict: A must-have for body work or other metal sanding, or for getting into hard-to-reach spots.
pros: Particularly effective at grinding out spot welds
cons: Some reports of this sander shredding belts, particularly if used on metal

customer_reviews.title: The 3m has a steel wheel and eats belts like crazy. The Astro has an adjustable regulator built ...
customer_reviews.text: I do collision repair for a living and this is a must need tool. I've only ever used the 3m one...And I prefer the Astro. This Astro has the rubber wheel and the belts last a long time. The 3m has a steel wheel and eats belts like crazy. The Astro has an adjustable regulator built and can obtain higher speeds than the 3m. This tool also a locking mechanism for changing the belts which makes it easier. Also the 3m you are constantly adjusting the belt tracking...Astro you set it and forget it.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, solid tool.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality tool, although not as powerful as the 3m tool it does the job for a lot less. Easy to adjust angle and super quick belt changes. Roller is not metal but rubber so the belts will last longer. I use it to grind down spot welds and to dress welds for collision repair. Overall pretty happy with the tool.
customer_reviews.author: Lu D.

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this and I did until 30 minutes into using this the and the rubber separated from the wheel. The seller did the refund quick though. Really, this sander would be great if the wheel was better but sadly I had to go to Ebay and spend more on a used dynabrade. The part that broke is cheap but I would use this professionally and wouldn't want to spend that much money on replacing wheels all the time.
customer_reviews.author: ericandkate

customer_reviews.title: Gets in tight places
customer_reviews.text: Good tool at a good price. I've been using this sander to remove old welds and cutting dross. Coarse belts remove material fast. The belts it comes with aren't worth much but I bought good belts and what a difference. The belt changing mechanism is super slick (takes about 10 seconds). I have only been using it for about a week but so far I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL P.

customer_reviews.title: great tool to have for auto work and other types with hard to reach areas
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 2 years ago and loved it for spot weld removal. Great tool. Treated it the same as all my other tools. I went to use it the other day and the whole belt "slide" fell off. The casting broke where it attaches to the main body. I believe this is call pot metal? Not sure. But, up until then worked like a charm every time. I will most certainly order another one. I am past my 1 year warranty and my bad for not buying an extended warranty. For the money it is not bad. Hopefully my next one will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great for getting paint off a wrought iron fence
customer_reviews.text: I needed to remove the paint off a wrought iron fence. While I could do much of the job with an angle grinder with a paint stripping disk, that was too big to reach some areas. I wasn't sure if this would do the job, but took a chance and it worked better than I expected. I had some concern that the paint might clog the narrow belts, but it didn't. The belts also lasted longer than I would have expected. So I was really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L Keck

customer_reviews.title: Great tool minor setbacks
customer_reviews.text: Really love the tool. Biggest downside is it's almost necessary to buy an extra rubber contact wheel as it will wear out rather quickly. Value for the money is great. Also should note mine also doesnt let me center the belt where I want it. My coworkers have the same model with zero issue so I believe mine to be an oddball. Either way overall it's worth the purchase for the cost.

customer_reviews.title: Works Extremely Well
customer_reviews.text: Just got this tool a few days ago so I only rated it a 4 star on longevity, but see no reason why this tool could not last years if properly taken care of. Almost all air tools are a little noisy, and you should be wearing ear protection anyway. I use this tool in the auto body field and it performs exceptionally. Grinds OEM spot welds and wire welds like there is no tomorrow. Extremely easy to change the belt, and once in place,...... DOES NOT wander. Again, very good well built tool.
